article.title: Searches for anomalous $tqZ$ couplings from the trilepton signal of $tZ$ associated production at the 14 TeV LHC

multiple_choice_question.text: Which Feynman diagrams depict the production of a top quark (t) and a Z boson, where the top quark decays to a W boson and a b quark, and the Z boson decays to a lepton pair (l+ l-)?
What does the peak in the M_(l1 l2) distribution around 90 GeV indicate?
Why do the signal and top quark-related background distributions peak around 175 GeV in the M_T(bl3E_T) distribution?
choices: It\'s the mass of the W boson.
It\'s the approximate mass of the top quark.
It\'s the energy scale of the LHC.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the branching ratio Br(t â†’ qZ) represent in this formula?
choices: The probability of a top quark decaying into any quark and a Z boson.
The probability of a top quark decaying into a specific up-type quark (u or c) and a Z boson.
The ratio of the decay widths of the top quark to a W boson and a b quark.
The energy difference between a top quark and a Z boson.
